A router can be used to make engravings, grooves, and patterns on wood, fiberglass or possibly even plastic. The trimming surface is not at the tip, but on the side of the router blade, so running along the wood's grain provides the most satisfying results. Routers can be found in a variety of sizes, and have different speeds. The PR20EVSK Colt Variable Speed Router with Edge Guide by Bosch is one of a variety of branded routers accessible on the market. A robust, long-lasting yet portable aluminium base helps to keep the weight of the PR20ECSK router down to about three pounds. One of Bosch's inventions, Constant Response circuitry, is used with the router. This makes it possible for burn-free trimming by retaining the rpm you selected and thus a unfailing speed, despite rough loads.
